intro: Hieracium acrotrichellum, commonly known as the smooth-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium acrotrichellum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some environments.
